intro: Luffa clavata, commonly known as the sponge gourd, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squashes. The plant produces large, fibrous fruits that mature into spongy structures used for scrubbing. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, while the flowers are typically yellow with five petals. Luffa clavata thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil and ample sunlight for optimal growth.
